quoteFirst: The next morning dawned bright and clear, with the sun shining warmly, and after breakfast we took a walk around the lawn in the rear of the castle, where Holmes claimed that intuition told him that Billie Budd would appear. It got around to a

quoteFirst: The battle cruisers, assisted by the _Carnarvon_, concentrated their fire, first on Admiral von Spee's ship, the _Scharnhorst_, which sank, refusing to cease firing, about 4 P.M.; next on the _Gneisenau_, which sank two hours afterwards. The German cruisers had meanwhile diverged southwards; but the _Glasgow_ overtook the _Leipzig_, and, with the _Cornwall_, sank her, after some hours' fighting, at
quoteLast: ; the _Kent_, meanwhile, came up with the _Nürnberg_, and sank her about 7.30 P.M.; while her crew were being picked up, the _Dresden_ and _Prinz Eitel Fritz_ got away.

quoteFirst: An earthquake shock was felt at
quoteLast: on the 27th. I was sitting in the Shack writing up records at the time, and it seemed as if somebody had struck the south-west end of the place a severe blow with a bag of sand. quoteFirst: "A small and early, and you come at a
quoteLast: !" said Ned, then paused, absolutely dazzled by the shiny folds, the moonlit clouds, the parted sheath of the bodice concealing surely the most beautiful thing in the world. quoteFirst: Especially on Sundays was this the case, but on this particular Sunday our friend the loquacious waiter was deputed to sit up for the new guest--the gentleman who had gone over to church at Wandsborough. quoteLast: or half-past at the latest.  But it was slow work sitting up alone in the deserted coffee-room, and so it speedily came to pass that the talkative one followed the example of the five foolish virgins--slumbered and slept.
